statements: SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE email_id = 1;
SELECT email_id, email_address, segmentation_criteria FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE;
SELECT email_id, email_address, send_date FROM segmentation_emails WHERE clicked = TRUE;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND clicked = TRUE;
SELECT email_id, email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE segmentation_criteria = 'VIP';
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE send_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT email_id, clicked FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails ORDER BY send_date DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT MAX(email_id) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT DISTINCT segmentation_criteria FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE send_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31';
SELECT email_id FROM segmentation_emails WHERE segmentation_criteria LIKE '%Special%';
SELECT AVG(email_id) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT MIN(send_date) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT email_address, send_date FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND send_date <= '2022-06-30';
SELECT email_id, opened, clicked FROM segmentation_emails WHERE email_address = 'test@example.com';
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE clicked = FALSE;
SELECT email_id, email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND clicked = FALSE;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND clicked = FALSE;
SELECT email_id, email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE clicked = TRUE ORDER BY send_date DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE;
SELECT email_address, send_date FROM segmentation_emails WHERE clicked = TRUE AND opened = TRUE;
SELECT DISTINCT segmentation_criteria FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE OR clicked = TRUE;
SELECT email_id, email_address, segmentation_criteria FROM segmentation_emails WHERE send_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE send_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-01';
SELECT email_id, email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND clicked = TRUE;
SELECT MAX(send_date) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT opened, COUNT(*) FROM segmentation_emails GROUP BY opened;
SELECT AVG(DATEDIFF(NOW(), send_date)) AS days_since_send FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT email_id, email_address, segmentation_criteria FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = FALSE AND clicked = FALSE;
SELECT SUM(IF(opened = TRUE, 1, 0)) AS opened_count, SUM(IF(clicked = TRUE, 1, 0)) AS clicked_count FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE AND clicked = TRUE ORDER BY send_date ASC;
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT email_address) FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT email_id, email_address FROM segmentation_emails WHERE send_date < '2022-01-01' AND opened = FALSE;
SELECT email_id, send_date FROM segmentation_emails WHERE opened = TRUE OR clicked = FALSE;
SELECT MIN(send_date) AS first_send_date FROM segmentation_emails;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, email, segment_id FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, segment_id, last_purchase_date FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM segments;
SELECT segment_id, segment_name FROM segments;
SELECT segment_id, segment_name, segment_description FROM segments;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, segment_name FROM customers JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email, segment_name FROM customers JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE segment_id = 1;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers WHERE segment_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE last_purchase_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE last_purchase_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY last_purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email FROM customers ORDER BY last_purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email FROM customers ORDER BY last_purchase_date ASC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email, segment_name FROM customers JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE customers.last_purchase_date > '2022-01-01';

SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email, segment_name FROM customers JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE customers.last_purchase_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY customers.last_purchase_date DESC;

SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email, segment_name FROM customers JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE customers.last_purchase_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY customers.last_purchase_date ASC;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE last_purchase_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT customer_name, segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT customer_name, segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE customers.last_purchase_date <= '2021-12-31';
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customers;
SELECT segment_id, COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM customers GROUP BY segment_id;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT segment_name, COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id GROUP BY segment_name;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE last_purchase_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31';
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id = 2 AND last_purchase_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT customer_name, segment_name, segment_description FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE segments.segment_name = 'Premium';
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY last_purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, segment_name, last_purchase_date FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id WHERE customer_name LIKE '%Smith%';
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John Doe' OR segment_id = 3;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id = (SELECT segment_id FROM segments WHERE segment_name = 'Silver');
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE last_purchase_date = (SELECT MIN(last_purchase_date) FROM customers);
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id = (SELECT MAX(segment_id) FROM segments);
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment_id IS NULL;
SELECT segment_name, COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM customers RIGHT JOIN segments ON customers.segment_id = segments.segment_id GROUP BY segment_name;
SELECT * FROM segmentations;
SELECT segmentation_id, segmentation_name FROM segmentations WHERE segmentation_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customer_behavior;
SELECT customer_id, email FROM customer_behavior WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM promotional_emails;
SELECT email_id, email_content FROM promotional_emails WHERE email_id = 1;
SELECT email_id, email_content, segmentation_id FROM promotional_emails WHERE segmentation_id = 1;
SELECT segmentation_id, COUNT(*) AS count FROM segmentations GROUP BY segmentation_id;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS total_purchases FROM customer_behavior WHERE purchase_history IS NOT NULL GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT email_id, email_content, segmentation_name FROM promotional_emails INNER JOIN segmentations ON promotional_emails.segmentation_id = segmentations.segmentation_id;
SELECT customer_id, email, COUNT(*) AS total_clicks FROM customer_behavior WHERE click_history IS NOT NULL GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT * FROM segmentations WHERE criteria LIKE '%valuable%';
SELECT * FROM customer_behavior WHERE purchase_history LIKE '%important%';
SELECT * FROM promotional_emails WHERE email_content LIKE '%exclusive%';
SELECT * FROM segmentations WHERE segmentation_name = 'VIP';
SELECT * FROM customer_behavior WHERE email = 'john.doe@example.com';
SELECT email_id, email_content FROM promotional_emails WHERE segmentation_id = (SELECT segmentation_id FROM segmentations WHERE segmentation_name = 'New Customers');
SELECT * FROM segmentations ORDER BY segmentation_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM customer_behavior ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM promotional_emails ORDER BY email_id ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM segmentations WHERE segmentation_id = 1;
SELECT segmentation_name FROM segmentations WHERE criteria LIKE '%important%';
SELECT customer_id, email FROM customer_behavior WHERE purchase_history LIKE '%high_value%' AND click_history LIKE '%engaged%';
SELECT s.segmentation_name, p.email_content FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id;
SELECT c.customer_id, c.email, s.segmentation_name FROM customer_behavior c JOIN promotional_emails p ON c.email = p.email JOIN segmentations s ON p.segmentation_id = s.segmentation_id;
SELECT c.customer_id, c.email, COUNT(p.email_id) AS num_emails_sent FROM customer_behavior c JOIN promotional_emails p ON c.email = p.email GROUP BY c.customer_id;
SELECT segmentation_name, COUNT(email_id) AS num_emails_sent FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id GROUP BY segmentation_name;

SELECT s.segmentation_name, COUNT(*) AS num_customers FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id JOIN customer_behavior c ON p.email = c.email GROUP BY s.segmentation_name;
SELECT s.segmentation_name, AVG(length(email_content)) AS avg_email_length FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id GROUP BY s.segmentation_name;
SELECT c.customer_id, CASE WHEN purchase_history LIKE '%high_value%' THEN 'Valuable Customer' ELSE 'Regular Customer' END AS customer_type FROM customer_behavior c;
SELECT s.segmentation_name, COUNT(p.email_id) AS num_emails_sent FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id WHERE s.segmentation_name LIKE '%target%';
SELECT * FROM promotional_emails WHERE segmentation_id IN (SELECT segmentation_id FROM segmentations WHERE criteria LIKE '%important%');
SELECT c.customer_id, c.email FROM customer_behavior c LEFT JOIN promotional_emails p ON c.email = p.email WHERE p.email_id IS NULL;
SELECT c.customer_id, COUNT(p.email_id) AS num_emails_sent FROM customer_behavior c LEFT JOIN promotional_emails p ON c.email = p.email GROUP BY c.customer_id;
SELECT s.segmentation_name, COUNT(email_id) AS num_emails_sent FROM segmentations s RIGHT JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id GROUP BY s.segmentation_name;
SELECT * FROM segmentations WHERE criteria IS NOT NULL ORDER BY segmentation_id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_id, email FROM customer_behavior WHERE purchase_history IS NULL OR click_history IS NULL;
SELECT email_id, email_content FROM promotional_emails WHERE segmentation_id BETWEEN 1 AND 3;
SELECT DISTINCT s.segmentation_name FROM segmentations s JOIN promotional_emails p ON s.segmentation_id = p.segmentation_id WHERE p.email_content LIKE '%exclusive%';
SELECT c.customer_id, c.email, SUM(length(p.email_content)) AS total_email_length FROM customer_behavior c JOIN promotional_emails p ON c.email = p.email GROUP BY c.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM segments;
SELECT segment_name FROM segments;
SELECT * FROM behaviors;
SELECT behavior_name FROM behaviors;
SELECT * FROM emails;
SELECT sent_date, opened, clicked FROM emails;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers INNER JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers LEFT JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers RIGHT JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id WHERE emails.opened = true;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id WHERE emails.clicked = true;
SELECT customers.first_name, segments.segment_name FROM customers INNER JOIN segments ON customers.segment = segments.segment_name;
SELECT customers.first_name, behaviors.behavior_name FROM customers INNER JOIN behaviors ON customers.customer_id = behaviors.behavior_id;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers INNER JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id WHERE emails.opened = false;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers INNER JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id WHERE emails.clicked = false;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers INNER JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id ORDER BY emails.sent_date ASC;
SELECT customers.first_name, emails.sent_date FROM customers INNER JOIN emails ON customers.customer_id = emails.customer_id ORDER BY emails.sent_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE segment = 'VIP';
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, s.segment_name FROM customers c JOIN segments s ON c.segment = s.segment_id;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, b.behavior_name FROM customers c JOIN behaviors b ON c.customer_id = b.behavior_id;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, e.sent_date FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, e.sent_date FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id WHERE e.opened = TRUE;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, e.sent_date FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id WHERE e.clicked = TRUE;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, COUNT(*) AS email_count FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id;
SELECT s.segment_name, COUNT(*) AS customer_count FROM customers c JOIN segments s ON c.segment = s.segment_id GROUP BY s.segment_name;
SELECT segment_name, behavior_name FROM segments s JOIN behaviors b ON s.segment_id = b.behavior_id;
SELECT first_name, last_name, sent_date FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id ORDER BY sent_date DESC;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, MAX(e.sent_date) AS last_email_sent_date FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id;

SELECT segment_name, AVG(num_emails) AS avg_emails_per_customer FROM (SELECT c.segment, COUNT(*) as num_emails FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id) AS temp JOIN segments s ON temp.segment = s.segment_id GROUP BY segment_name;
SELECT first_name, last_name, opened, clicked FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id WHERE opened = clicked;

SELECT s.segment_name, COUNT(*) AS clicked_count FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id JOIN segments s ON c.segment = s.segment_id WHERE e.clicked = TRUE GROUP BY s.segment_name;
SELECT first_name, last_name, COUNT(*) AS behavior_count FROM customers c JOIN behaviors b ON c.customer_id = b.behavior_id GROUP BY c.customer_id;
SELECT segment_name, opened, COUNT(*) AS email_count FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id JOIN segments s ON c.segment = s.segment_id GROUP BY segment_name, opened;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, e.sent_date FROM customers c LEFT JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, e.sent_date FROM customers c RIGHT JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id;

SELECT s.segment_name, COUNT(*) AS num_emails FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id JOIN segments s ON c.segment = s.segment_id GROUP BY s.segment_name HAVING num_emails > 10;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, COUNT(*) AS reactivated_customers FROM customers c JOIN emails e ON c.customer_id = e.customer_id WHERE e.clicked = TRUE GROUP BY c.customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segmentation = 'Premium';
SELECT * FROM orders;
SELECT order_id, order_date, total_amount FROM orders WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products;
SELECT * FROM products WHERE price > 50.00;
SELECT * FROM segmentation_rules;
SELECT rule_name FROM segmentation_rules WHERE rule_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM email_campaigns;
SELECT campaign_name FROM email_campaigns WHERE campaign_type = 'Promotional';
SELECT customer_name, email, total_amount FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, product_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.order_id = products.product_id;
SELECT campaign_name, campaign_type FROM email_campaigns WHERE segmentation = 'Standard';

SELECT customers.customer_name, orders.order_date, email_campaigns.campaign_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN email_campaigns ON customers.segmentation = email_campaigns.segmentation;
SELECT customer_name, total_amount FROM customers LEFT JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT product_name, price, customer_name FROM products JOIN orders ON products.product_id = orders.order_id JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id;

SELECT customer_name, email, total_amount, campaign_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN email_campaigns ON customers.segmentation = email_campaigns.segmentation WHERE campaign_type = 'Promotional';

SELECT customer_name, email, total_amount, campaign_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id LEFT JOIN email_campaigns ON customers.segmentation = email_campaigns.segmentation WHERE campaign_type IS NULL OR campaign_type = 'General';

SELECT customers.customer_name, orders.order_date, products.product_name, segmentation_rules.rule_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.order_id = products.product_id JOIN segmentation_rules ON customers.segmentation = segmentation_rules.segmentation;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE segmentation = 'VIP';
SELECT order_id, total_amount FROM orders WHERE total_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, total_amount FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id;
SELECT product_name, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT customer_name, total_amount FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE total_amount > 500;
SELECT campaign_name, campaign_type FROM email_campaigns WHERE segmentation = 'New Customers';
SELECT customer_name, order_date, total_amount FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT c.customer_name, p.product_name, p.price FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN products p ON o.order_id = p.product_id;
SELECT rule_name, segmentation FROM segmentation_rules WHERE rule_name LIKE '%discount%';
SELECT DISTINCT segmentation FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, order_date FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31';
SELECT campaign_name, COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM email_campaigns GROUP BY campaign_name;
SELECT customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT DISTINCT customer_id FROM orders WHERE total_amount > 500);
SELECT c.customer_name, COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_name HAVING total_orders > 3;
SELECT campaign_name, campaign_type, COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM email_campaigns GROUP BY campaign_name, campaign_type;
SELECT DISTINCT segmentation FROM customers WHERE segmentation IS NOT NULL;
SELECT c.customer_name, p.product_name FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id LEFT JOIN products p ON o.order_id = p.product_id;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com%';
SELECT AVG(total_amount) AS average_amount FROM orders;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, total_amount FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id ORDER BY order_date ASC LIMIT 5;
